column3: Tagged for 0.18 because I'd consider this a bugfix
Concept ACK.\n\nWe should also consider doing that for `importmulti` (at least per descriptor).
utACK https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/commit/0bedcbafdfaa0e980ad91c0ba4b9039575017f0e\n\n@achow101 want to take a look?
@promag Wouldn't it doe that, as the unique ptr gets destroyed (and flush on exit was set to `true` by default)?
@MarcoFalke yap, it wasn't clear. Maybe worth a comment.\n\n@jonasschnelli is there a rationale for 1000?

> On line 387, before throwing, shouldn't it commit the batch?

As @MarcoFalke said, if the unique pointer gets out of the scope, it "commits" (flushes) to the database.

> @jonasschnelli is there a rationale for 1000?

Not really. I thought 1000 is a good compromise between cache memory requirements and performance. A new constant looked after an overkill. Initially I wanted to tie it

1000 seems like a good upper bound, since the speedup flattens out after this:

(time in us)

![upgradekeymetadata time](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6399679/52975475-b1572c00-3393-11e9-92ed-f5483b428452.png)
